Moreover, fluoride has been associated with endocrine disruption. Given that the thyroid is one of the most sensitive organs in the body to environmental toxins, this is a critical point.

Meanwhile, the risks—ranging from dental fluorosis to neurodevelopmental harm—are well-documented.

In conclusion, adding fluoride to public water supplies is a practice rooted more in ideology than in sound, individualized medicine. It's time to move beyond mass dosing with a substance that has known toxic properties and instead focus on targeted, safer dental care strategies that respect individual choice and health.
